CatDescriptText: Dorothy Hardis, maid, Carlton House, 306 Roberts Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 26, 1958, pg. 6 with question: "Do you believe the trouble in Middle East will start an atomic world war?" answer reads: "No, I think we are too well prepared. Russia wants to catch us unaware.  I don't believe we will have a war right away."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Dorothy Hardis, wearing eyeglasses, light colored sleeveless patterned dress with dark belt, standing with hands on shopping cart in store interior with shelves of products, including "Scuff Kate", "Griffin Microsheen", and "Energine Charcoal Lighter"
